events.name: Tech Workshop by Microsoft - HDB Cool Ideas Hack
events.description:
At the Tech Workshop by Microsoft, Monday, 20 June, our friends from Microsoft will give you the low-down on Azure, their cloud platform designed to help you build and deploy applications rapidly.  At this workshop, experts from Microsoft will walk you through the basics of using the platform and how you can use it to prototype your idea at the HDB Cool Ideas Hack. Learn about the Azure IoT Suite and how you can use it to power IoT projects. Also find out how to build cross-platform Xamarin apps with the Azure apps service.  
Programme  
1. Leveraging the power of Azure IoT Suite for IoT development  
2. How to develop IoT projects using Azure IoT Suite with Raspberry Pi2 or Pimoroni Hat 
3. Creating cross-platform Xamarin apps with Azure apps service  
 
Also, don't forget to check out the Themes & Insights Workshop for a deeper look at the hackathon challenges, and the Community Design Workshop, for a detailed ideation exercise based on human-centric design, to help you start thinking about your idea.  
More Information  
To learn more about the HDB Cool Ideas Hack, visit the microsite here.
events.location: Toa Payoh Room, HDB Hub, 480 Lorong 6 Toa Payoh, Singapore 310480

events.name: Singapore MusicTech - June Meetup
events.description: Speakers: • Chinmay Pendharkar - Chinmay is an audio engineer and he's passionate about audio, acoustics and technology. He organized WebAudio Hack Day last year which was super awesome. He has spoken about WebAudio at audio-tech at various events. His blog includes many of his personal projects that are mainly around audio-tech. • Gerry Beaugard - Gerry is the creator of AudioStretch. He is an inventor, musician, and occasional triathlete. His current work mainly involve audio technology for iOS and the web. His past job includes writing speech recognition software for Apple, creating automatic video editing software for muvee, and designing ASICs for Nortel Agenda: • 6:45pm: Come, have some pizza and say hello to each other • 7:20pm: Audio DSP Programming Basics Gerry • 7:50pm: WebAudio: an Emerging Platform for Modern Audio Applications by Chinmay  // covering things like resampling/interpolating, mixing, and basic filtering (e.g. using low-pass, band-pass, and high-pass biquad filters) with audio examples • 8:20pm: Show & Tell (by members if any) Related Links: • Web Audio API: https://webaudio.github.io/web-audio-api/ • Web Audio School: http://mmckegg.github.io/web-audio-school/ • Audio Signal Processing for Music Applications: https://www.coursera.org/course/audio
events.location: PayPal 7th Floor, 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Singapore
